docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 27 The Committee of 24 on Decolonization has returned from Africa with a general resolution endorsing all struggles against colonial rule and calling on United Nations members to give aid, including arms, to the rebels.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 27 The Committee of 24 on Decolonization has returned from Africa with a general resolution endorsing all struggles against colonial rule and calling on United Nations members to give aid, including arms, to the rebels.
docs.abstract: com resolution backs all struggles against colonial rule; urges Security Council make obligatory econ and mil sanctions provided for under UN Charter; urges Portugal's allies to halt sale or transport of arms to Portugal

headline.main: U.N. BODY ASKS AID FOR AFRICA REBELS; After Tour, Group Supports All Anticolonial Struggles

docs.snippet: LONDON, July 7 British bookmakers, people seldom perplexed in this gambling nation, have cast jaundiced eyes toward World Cup competition, the forthcoming international soccer tournament among teams from 16 nations.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 7 British bookmakers, people seldom perplexed in this gambling nation, have cast jaundiced eyes toward World Cup competition, the forthcoming international soccer tournament among teams from 16 nations.

headline.main: Bookies Cast Jaundiced Eyes Toward World Soccer Tourney

byline.original: By WILLIAM N. WALLACE Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LONDON, July 9 (AP) Queen Elizabeth will open the eighth world soccer championships at London's Wembley Stadium on Monday. Sixteen of the world's best teams will play through July 30 for the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 9 (AP) Queen Elizabeth will open the eighth world soccer championships at London's Wembley Stadium on Monday. Sixteen of the world's best teams will play through July 30 for the World Cup.

headline.main: World Cup Soccer Tourney Opens Tomorrow; 16 Teams to Compete in London Brazil Title Choice Again

docs.snippet: Dave Newmark, a 7-foot-1inch Columbia junior, and four other collegians were named yesterday for the 10-man basketball squad that will represent the United States in the PanAmerican Maccabiah Games at Sao Paolo, Brazil, Aug. 23 to 28.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dave Newmark, a 7-foot-1inch Columbia junior, and four other collegians were named yesterday for the 10-man basketball squad that will represent the United States in the PanAmerican Maccabiah Games at Sao Paolo, Brazil, Aug. 23 to 28.

headline.main: U.S. Five Names Newmark For Brazil Games Aug. 23
